When you <b>spend a day exploring a region in search of adventure…</b><br /><br />This is a set-up with a lot of possibilities for groups just looking around for trouble in a new land they haven’t fully explored yet. The goals I have in mind would be:<br /><br />* Give everyone a chance to contribute<br />* Generate points of interest on the fly (q.v. Perilous Wilds)<br />* Make some random encounters/introduce dangers<br />* Set-up future adventures<br /><br />So, how would you write such a move?
<div id='comment z130enhbuxaoudgkn23njdfqcxerin4kk'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/113773664211549019121_photo.jpg'> Owen Kerr</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-06-20 05:25:10 (edited: 2017-06-20 05:25:10)</cite></p>
        <p>Have you ever looked at a Dirty Dungeon (ala John Wick)? <br /><br />Long story short, have a map of the area with a lot of blank spaces. Ask the players to help you fill it in.  If they give you a good, solid piece of information (&quot;A tribe of ogres lives there.&quot;), then let the party hold one. If they say &quot;There&#39;s a mountain ridge over here, (drawing it) and the watershed supports these three villages (drawing them). Rumors of gargoyles in the mountains,&quot; then they&#39;ve given info and created a content artifact. That&#39;s worth two hold.  If they just knock it out of the park, (&quot;There&#39;s a holy city of gnolls there! Here&#39;s a map of the city, a description of the sewers underneath, and a list of five NPCs!&quot;), that&#39;s worth at least three hold.<br /><br />The players have that hold, and can spend them one-for-one for a +1 forward <b>after the roll has been made.</b> Reward them for initiative and for their contribution to the campaign world.<br /><br />The kicker: for every three of the players&#39; hold, you hold one. Spend that hold, one-for-one, to make some of the information wrong. The ridge is actually like this, the ogres are actually trolls, the gargoyles got driven out by the manticores, a chunk of the sewer description is in error, whatever. Don&#39;t make it too big of a change, but enough that the PCs have to shift on the fly to deal with the new information.<br /><br />Try it. The players like the additional agency, and you have to do less work. Bonus. If your group likes it, thank John Wick. Cheers!</p>
</div>

<div id='comment z130enhbuxaoudgkn23njdfqcxerin4kk'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/109791996665503926061_photo.jpg'> Robert Rendell</h4>
      <p><cite>2017-06-20 23:32:48 (edited: 2017-06-20 23:32:48)</cite></p>
        <p>If you did make a custom move to generate content like this, I feel that the way that you as the player trigger the move would have a big effect on the results.<br /><br />(the below aren&#39;t attempts at actual custom moves, they&#39;re just the basic idea)<br /><br />* If you spend the day asking around town, roll +CHA.  You&#39;ll learn rumours, local folklore and perhaps be directed to someone who saw something.<br />* If you spend the day researching records at an archive or library, roll +INT.  You&#39;ll find historical tracts, intriguing references, maps (perhaps out-of-date) and cryptic messages.<br />* If you spend the day exploring the wilderness, roll +WIS (or perhaps +CON).  You&#39;ll come across signs of activity (tracks, chopped trees, the aftermath of a battle), find ruins or lost roads, or hints of natural wonders.</p>
</div>
